text: I'm about to walk in so right now I'm
taking the infinite egg for a test run
as I walk the treads moves from beneath
me and I control the pace by just
heating up and it feeds into it faster
so far it feels really natural I can
navigate it and turn in any direction I
can rotate and moonwalk so if it was
walking I think I'm ready to try the VR
I'm embarking on a Japanese Zen garden
right now so as I look around me there's
a 360-degree view of this beautiful zen
garden I feel like this is stress relief
although I will say oh I just walked
into a fountain what is really cool
about this is that this allows me to
take control of the virtual reality I'm
navigating it at my own free will so
running has been a little bit of a
struggle and that if you swerve to the
side it takes a pretty hard curve into
the sea oh my the ability to navigate a
scene in VR is unlike anything I've
experienced yet I was kind of tripping
over myself it felt like I was drunk
enough it's still prototype they're
gonna be rolling infinite deck out in
military filmmaking physical therapy
markets first and then consumer markets
in the distant future I'm excited to see
what's in the future for infinity
